course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Chinese Language, Logic, and Science
course.description: The structure of language helps shape the way of reasoning. This course examines the relationship between the two. Other topics to be discussed in the course include: ambiguity and vagueness in the Chinese language, and the methods used to clarify them; structures of various genres of the Chinese language; morphological and syntactic types of the worldâ€™s languages; linguistic structure and language families; the nature of traditional Chinese logic reflected in Mozi and Gongsun Long; comparison among Aristotelian logic, Indian logic and Chinese logic; the nature of the traditional Chinese science and culture; fundamental differences between modern science and traditional Chinese science.
